column1: 11:00|"eleven o’clock in the morning"|"Pooh always liked a little something at eleven o’clock in the morning
column2: and he was very glad to see Rabbit getting out the plates and mugs; and when Rabbit said
column3: ‘Honey or condensed milk with your bread?’ he was so excited that he said
column6: so as not to seem greedy
column9: please.’ And for a long time after that he said nothing … until at last
column10: humming to himself in a rather sticky voice
column12: shook Rabbit lovingly by the paw
column13: and said that he must be going on."|"Winnie-The-Pooh (UK)"|"A. A. Milne"

column1: ap ~ 00:00|"About twelve"|"‘It isn’t the sort of thing you can do in the afternoon
column2: ’ said Piglet quickly. ‘It’s a very particular morning thing
column3: that has to be done in the morning
column6: between the hours of – What would you say the time was?’

column3: the hours of twelve and twelve five. So
column6: if you’ll excuse me – What’s that?’"|"Winnie-The-Pooh (UK)"|"A. A. Milne"
